label: Community
description: A template highlighting community, support, and how to get involved.
content:
# Project Title

## üåü Community

Join our community on [Discord](https://discord.gg/your-invite) or follow us on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/your-handle)!

## üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Support

If you have any questions or need help, open an issue or join our discussions.

## ü§ù How to Contribute

- Fork the repo
- Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b feature/AmazingFeature`)
- Commit your changes
- Push to the branch
- Open a Pull Request

content:

label: Bug Report
description: A template for users to report bugs effectively.
content:
# üêõ Bug Report

**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '...'
3. Scroll down to '...'
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
- OS: [e.g. Windows, MacOS, Linux]
- Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]
- Version [e.g. 22]

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

label: Feature Request
description: A template for users to suggest new features.
content:
# üöÄ Feature Request

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when ...

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

label: Getting Started
description: A template for a quick start section to help users get up and running.
content:
# üöÄ Getting Started

Follow these steps to get your project up and running quickly.

## Prerequisites
- Node.js >= 18
- npm >= 9

## Installation
```bash
npm install your-package
```

## Usage
```bash
npm start
```

label: Contributing Guide
description: A template for a contributing section to encourage collaboration.
content:
# ü§ù Contributing

We welcome contributions!

- Fork the repository
- Create a new branch (`git checkout -b feature/YourFeature`)
- Make your changes
- Submit a pull request

Please read [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for more details.
